Thanks for finding my video and pressing play!

Here‚Äôs a little trip report I‚Äôve had in my back pocket for a while. I travelled on this trip back in September (as you can probably tell from the weather!) and finally got around to editing it. 

East Midlands Trains offer some of the best value first class fares in the whole country. This trip took just over two hours and cost just ¬£16.50 (that‚Äôs with a third off thanks to my railcard), fantastic value. These cheap fares can only usually be found in the middle of the day, outside the peak. So what better way to travel to London than in first class?

There is a lunch menu on board East Midlands Trains. Link to the PDF here: https://www.eastmidlandstrains.co.uk/Documents/Menus/1/EMT%20All%20Day%20Menu%20Web%20Friendly.pdf

So join me as I travel on a 125mph-capable Class 222 Meridian train and race south down one of Britain‚Äôs perhaps lesser known main lines. 

For those of you wanting to see more train trips...I have another one coming out in the next week or so, Plus I‚Äôve got plans to film something great - and a bit different - in January. 

I have lots of videos coming out, including in midweek in the run up to New Year. Make sure you have your notifications set! üõé
